intro: Ossaea macrandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Ossaea macrandra is noted for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it well adapted to drought conditions.
